ai.summary: An 11.8 km circular walk in the UK with moderate difficulty, taking you through estate parkland, woodlands and open fields. Expect gentle ascents, well-maintained paths and scenic views around Gregynog.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly well-defined paths and tracks across estate grounds, mixed with woodland trails and short stretches of grassy fields. Surfaces range from compact gravel to damp earth; can be muddy after rain. Elevation changes are gradual with occasional steps.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours before you set out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a layered outfit. Stay on marked paths and respect private land. Carry a map or GPS, enough water and some snacks. Have a small first aid kit and a phone with emergency numbers. Be aware of livestock and ticks in woodland; be prepared for variable UK conditions.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; year-round hiking is possible but winter conditions can be more challenging.

seo.meta_description: Explore the 11.8 km Gregynog Long Circular Walk in the UK. A moderate, scenic loop through estate parkland and woodlands with gentle hills.
